page.title: 04The River Nar
page.content: The source of the river NAR is at Litcham a village out of the block which is approximately one KM west.The river is a good example of working {ecology}as it has an abundance of wildlife and suffers from very little polution.As our{landscape}gently undulates so the course of the river slowly meanders.The average flow of the water during June 1985 was half a metre per second.As it is so near the source,the width of the river never exceeded one and a half metres during the period of observation. There have been some measures taken to stop the bank eroding into the river.These are in the form of sandbags along the river.Limited{recreation}is possibleas fishing licences are obtainable from Lexham Hall Estate.The river is not used for{communications}purposes.
